Unfortunately, the service is very bad, and the barbers are beginners, especially the one named Youssef. His hand is shaking; he seems nervous and is clearly just learning.

The prices are outrageous. Is it reasonable to get a beard trim, hair styling, and steam treatment for 175 riyals?!

Honestly, the work done by Indian barbers at other salons for 10 riyals is a hundred times better than this salon.

Based on my personal experience, I do not recommend dealing with them.

(Translated by Google)
First, I want to thank the owner of the shop who hired such ethical, courteous, and skilled barbers.

May God bless you abundantly. And to be honest, I came based on the reviews, and they were absolutely right. A haircut at the shop of the artist and master, Youssef, was truly exceptional, showcasing his creativity and artistry. Some might say their prices are high compared to other shops, but honestly, they use excellent quality clippers and maintain impeccable cleanliness. I recommend getting a haircut there, but don't focus solely on the price; everything good has its value. I also highly recommend the Moroccan bath; it's truly worth every penny. Best of luck to the owner and staff. A customer's advice: I hope you continue with your cleanliness, artistry, creativity, and excellence. We look forward to even better things in the future.
